Have you ever notices that it is warmer right before the sun rises?

Normally, I wouldn't notice that, but seeing as I'm up at the buttcrack of dawn, I thought maybe I would study it seeing as I'll probebly be up at this time for the next two years or more.  

Have you ever has something eating away at you, and you didn't know what?  Its like an empty feeling inside that you don't really notice until you start to think about it and how it got there.  I used to have that big empty feeling.  Now its much smaller and I barely notice it or care to notice it anymore.  For now, it is as much apart of me as everything else is, and though eventually I will figure out how to repair it, right now it proves to be no real threat.  

In a way, Emilia has saved my heart.  Because of her, I know that I will always be able to love no matter what happens and who breaks it.  It will always beat because now it has a definate purpose.  I'd love to say that all my worries about ending up alone from now until who knows when has been taken care of and no longer exist, however, such thoughts have risen again.  I don't mull over it like I did before until it makes me so miserable that I can hardly breathe.  I have no time for that anymore, and I have to be here for Emma.  However, its like a dull pain and a nagging voice in the back of my mind preaching what I've tried so hard to get rid of.  You're not good enough, you're not interesting enough, if you were anything worth keeping, someone would have kept you.  I hate that little voice.  I have been trying so hard to convince myself otherwise for the past who knows how many months.  

I stand in front of the mirror, and instead of picking things that I hate about my appearance, I pick things that I love.  Like my eye.  One of my eyes has a brown spot in it.  Its unique.  Only I have that eye.  And I think its cool.  There are so many things that I have discovered about myself.  Like, if I am upset, a lot of times I'll lie about it and say I'm not just so people don't worry about me.  I don't like causing other people grief.  I don't like to talk much anymore.  The only time I really talk to anyone is at D & D or church.  And even at Church, I tend to stay quiet, only responding with a couple of words.  I keep to myself, no longer wanting to be the center of attention.  If all eyes are on me, I shy away.  A bit of the butterfly I used to be will come out around friends, but not oftan.  I am just as quick to anger as I was, however I'll actually sit and think about it for a second before I respond, which has been something that I was never good at in the past.  

Some days, I feel so happy that it seems impossible that I could ever be sad again.  I had a straight month and a half of such happiness, but now I know that it does indeed leave for periods of time and in its place hatches worry, and a little anger.  I think...If he stays with me, I want it to be because he wants me and loves me, not because he's afraid of hurting me.  See, I can get over heartbreak.  I have done it before.  That pain is always there in small amounts, but the majority of it goes away and I can breathe and smile again.  I can stand up and try again.  My cousin and an old friend thinks I'm brave (or stupid) for being able to keep trying.  I guess I am the undying inbodyment of hope.  Which sucks sometimes because that hope gets me into pain in the first place.  I will admit that I am scared.  I mean, who the hell isn't?  You'd have to be an idiot not to be scared.  But at least I admit it and go forth in the HOPE that maybe I'll conquer that fear and never have to feel it again.  

-sigh-  I'm done rambling.  Right now, I have to go feed myself before I pass out.  I'm going to talk to my aunt and see about starting to lift weights again.  ^.^ I now have hips!  I'm so excited!  I love my figure in complete now!  I work out just for the sheer joy of lifting something heavy and knowing that somewhere in the world, there is someone who can't lift something as heavy as you.  Like my brother -evil grin-  just kidding.  My favorite excersizes are my abdomen ones and my leg ones.  I love my legs.  I think they are my best feature, so when I work them out and see them improve more to strength, its one of the best feelings in the world.  I lurve it.  Well, off to eat and get ready for church.  

Signing off!

Well, I am tired.  LOL, very tired.  And my memory is failing.  But I am alive.  

Congratulations Tom and Em.  I am so happy for you.  I wish I could be there when you guys get married, but I have no way to get there and a baby to boot.  ^.^ You guys should have it here instead.  In any case, Congrats and I love you both!  I hope you have a happy life together!  

All is well here.  I took Emma to get her pictures taken today.  Her first pictures.  She slept through all but the last two.  She is absolutely adorable.  Valerie knows.  she saw a kind of bad copy of it that comes on the receipt, but it was good enough to get the basic idea.  She had her eyes open and everything.  ^.^ 

Well, only time for a quick update and let everyone know that I am alive and well.

Its been a little while since I have updated here.  For those of you who don't know already, I had my baby girl last monday at 11:47 p.m.  It was a baby girl, and she is beautiful.  Shes a really good baby too.  She is pretty calm and doesn't cry much.  She makes some of the most adorable expressions too.  However, in the course of a week, I have managed to get a bit of the baby blues.  

I feel horrible today.  I feel terrible that I feel horrible, mainly because I have no reason to feel horrible.  I have a healthy and beautiful baby girl and so much else that makes me happier than I have ever been, but I guess its just that my fears are starting to get to me.  Fears and worries.  Old ones, new ones, stupid unfounded ones.  They are all there and I've managed to think of all of them.  

It really doesn't help that I miss Tyler so much.  He couldn't make it to the birth.  He tried to find a flight, but when its the week of Christmas, its kind of hard to do that.  I just miss him and he has been so busy and tired lately.  I don't know, whenever I get an e-mail or a call from him, I can feel myself become lighter and happier.  He was probebly late this morning or just didn't have time today, or the internet was going all funky, but I really could have used the smile today.  One of the bigger unfounded or stupid worries I've been mulling over would be that I'm scared of losing him.  This is the best relationship I've literally ever had and I'm afraid of losing him.  All my dating life, I have managed to short-change myself.  And the ones that I didn't short change myself on I ended up running away from because it was strange and unfamiliar to me and I didn't want to get hurt.  With those ones, I couldn't understand what in the heck they would be doing with me and I was convinced that at some point they would leave.  That fear is back now and no matter how hard I try to push it away, it still remains one of those old fears.  I know that I trust him and I know that I wouldn't leave him despite that fear because of how right this relationship feels to me.  But its there as one of those stupid, unfounded fears.  I have no reason to fear it, I just do.  When he tells me he loves me or he misses me, its so reassuring.  I know that I'm not becoming too boring for him or that he has not changed his mind about being with me.  otherwise, I feel a little scared.  Everything that has ever seemed so good in my life has ended.  It has always been like that quote written on my cousin's wall;  'If something seems too good to be true, than it probebly is.'  I'm afraid that once again, that quote will be true.  I'm afraid of ending up alone later in life and I'm afraid of failing.  I'm afraid of failing myself, my family, my friends and most of all my daughter.  I'm afraid that if I become too stressed I'll go back to my old habits that I have been working so hard to leave behind, like the smoking.  I'm afraid of the type of person I used to be.  I'm afraid that I'll never be able to get into college and get that degree so that I can teach.  I'm afraid of how much love I feel for my daughter.  I'm afraid of how much I love Tyler and just how much power he does have over me.  I'm afraid of falling and hitting the ground.  You know what I'm really afraid of though?  These stupid baby blues.  I have so many things to be happy about and that I am happy about.  I haven't felt sad like this in a very long time and I'm not used to it anymore.  I hate this feeling when I used to revel in it.  It gave me an excuse to pity myself and write repetative poetry and lyrics about the world ending and all that.  It gave me an excuse to whine and complain about just how much my life sucked and how unfair everything was.  I hate that person.  I've learned to love myself in so many different ways and just how much I am worth, and when I think about it, I know that I hate that person that I used to be.  

So what I am going to do right now, is think of everything I have that makes my life ten times better then it ever has been, take a long bath, watch one of my favorite Disney movies while I cuddle under a blanket with my baby daughter in my arms, and enjoy everything that I have and wouldn't give up for the world.  I'm going to forget my worries and fears now that I have typed them up and left them on a page instead of in my head, and I'm going to have an awsome night and meet everyone and everything with a smile.  It might now be a solution, but it is a start.  Maybe tomorrow I will feel better because of my venting on here.  I guess we all have our bad days and I am no different.  I was overdue for one anyway ^.^

When I close my eyes I see a whole different world.  Its one that can never be copied onto paper or canves as it is ever-changing.  I love how my mind can wander and see different things.  Sometimes I see 'snapshots'.  My most recent 'snapshot' is me and Emma on a porch, sitting on the cement steps.  We are both wearing these tye-dye shirts and she looks to be about two or three years old.  She is sitting between my legs with her back to me and I'm holding her small hands in mine.  We both have this big smile on our faces.  Our feet are bare and we both have cut-off blue jean shorts on.  The whole scene is so beautiful to me.  Its surreal in a way, something that one could have seen in the 60's.  It looks so happy and I can't help but hope that some day, the 'snapshot' will become real.  Who was holding the camera?  Who were we smiling so avidly for?  Where were we?  Questions that will hopefully have answers at some point.  I can't help but smile at these thoughts.  I can see myself on that same day chasing her around an old tree, her little girlish giggle echoing in the air and encouraging me to 'try and catch' her.  I can already feel the cool grass between my feet and the light I feel within my heart.  Such random beauty, but I can't wait to do all that.

Don't know what it stands for, but thats alright!  -sigh-  Boring life at the moment.  2 more months before my baby girl is born, and I am excited about that.  I have been writing alot lately.  Mostly short stories.  I guess I should probebly update my fanfiction before everyone goes all nuts on me.  

I'm eating chinese food.

go me.

Well another day is nearing it's end and a long day it has been.  I woke up at 6:00 this morning because I had to take that three hour glucose test to make sure I don't have gestational diabetes.  I failed the one hour one.  I couldn't eat anything after midnight and so I was really hungry and the monkey within was starting to protest.  Anyway, So, I got there early and sat for a while.  They called me back, took a blood sample to make sure of my blood level was right, and then sent me out while they processed it.  a half an hour later, they brought me a glucola as they call it, and I had to drink it before five minutes was up.  That stuff is so nasty.  Its really really sweet and it has a nasty aftertaste.  -shudder-  Anyway, so I had to wait an hour after that, they took another blood sample and then let me take up residence for the next two hours in a bed because I was feeling sick and exausted.  I find out the results tomorrow.  

Anyway, so I get home and I'm eating some leftover potato salad from dinner last night, and I had to stop because I was starting to feel sick again.  I stood and walked towards the house, but had to stop and lay down in the grass because I felt like I was going to pass out.  I was horribly shaky and felt really weak.  After trying to gather my wits, I walked as fast as I could to the house before my legs gave out, and laid down for a while in a chair.  Once I was confident enough in my legs not to call for help to get downstairs, I went to my room and tried to take a nap for a couple of hours, but I didn't get very far.  I didn't sleep very well last night.  Luckily, I feel better now.  I just feel like laying around and doing nothing because I'm still a bit tired.  

I made it through another day.  I always knew I would, but I discovered that if I keep myself busy doing something and listening to music, I'm distracted and don't really think about anything.  Stress seems to just fade away for a while.  I'm starting into the compulsive cleaning state again that I was in before working at walmart.  I'm happier when I'm busy.  I seriously never thought I'd say this, but scrubbing counters, sweeping, and looking at the progression in the room that you've been cleaning is very therapeutic in a way.  I decided to make dinner tonight despite the fact that it would probebly be only me and my brother eating.  I made this beanless chili stuff and cornbread.  I had to stop eating it because it was already beginning to give me heartburn, but everything gives me heartburn.  

I've been working on short stories and rants lately.  It also seems to keep my mind from wandering to all the bad things that could happen.  I was reading this pregnancy book, and I guess that most women in their third Trimester start to worry about everything that can go wrong with the baby and just around her in general.  That made me feel better too.  Sometimes I feel so stupid for worrying about the things I worry about all the time even when there is solidity that it is not going to happen.  

Yesterday, we got to listen to Emilia's heartbeat.  It was so funny.  The doctor pushed the thingy-probe-whatever-you-want-to-call-it into my stomach and she kicked it.  And you could hear her kick it!  There was this steady strong hearbeat and then a 'thump' that sounded like someone tapping a microphone.  She did it twice.  I'm really excited to meet her.  Valerie has christened her 'Bug'.  I guess every child needs some strange kind of nickname.  My mom's brothers and my grandmother all called me pumpkin when I was little.  When I turned ten my uncle Larry stopped calling me pumpkin and started calling me little sis.  ^.^ He still calls me little sis.  Those are the only nicknames I've really ever had except for Ella or El-Train.  ^.^ I love Dani for that nickname.  She started calling me El-Train when we went cliff-diving two years ago.  Those were some good times. 

Alot of things happened in the past week that I haven't mentioned yet.  One is actually quite important.  Brandon e-mailed me.  We had a sort of falling out a while back because of my idiocy and he surprised me with an e-mail.  I had been really nervous before I opened it, but we've reconciled and are hoping to become friends again.  I'm really glad for that.  I missed him a great deal.  Our friendship most likely will never be the same as it was before, but that is such with starting over.  I'm just glad that he is giving me another chance.  I feel lucky for that.

I have three Home and Garden parties going on right now.  They are catalog parties and hopefully they will do well.  I've been trying to encourage the hostesses the best I can and answering questions, but I'm very new at this and don't know the ropes yet.  I am learning though.  I have two parties scheduled for november so far, hopefully more will be made.  Eventually, I'm going to call my aunts in Utah after I've saved some money and become a bit more confident in myself and I'm going to go to Utah for a week and do however many parties I can.  I guess Utah is wide open territory ready for whoever wants it.  Depending on how good everything goes, I may end up going down there every month to two months for a week to do whatever parties are booked off of the first ones.  The place has great potential and I need to do the best I can.  So, cross your fingers for me.

Anyway, well, I'm going to skip and try to finish another short story.  I really need to work on my form, wording, and the general idea.  I think that I want to get everything in so badly that I miss out at parts and don't explain things particularly well, therefore leaving the piece seemingly unfinished and insensible.  So, hopefully, I can start to work on that.  Till later.

Okay, Emma is still healthy and strong and all that.  Boy am I glad.  I thought I was paranoid before.  I'm a klutz, and I'm afraid of tripping and banging into something or falling down the stairs...I actually almost fell down the stairs a week ago.  Scared the shit out of me.  My brother and I had just gotten into a fight and he had just got done telling me how much he hated me, so I was leaving the room and going downstairs to calm down.  I tripped on the top stair and fumbled/slid a bit before I could get a grip on the rail, hence saving myself from tumbling down.  I had made a loud noise about it apparently because my brother came running into the dining room asking if I was alright and if Emilia was alright.  He then apologized, I apologized and I was able to catch my breath.  

Having weird dreams still.  The other night I had a dream about craving butterfingers and this little pocketbook/hairless-rabbit was chasing me around trying to bite my legs off because it picked up one of my butterfingers when I dropped it and I took it back.  

Anyway, I'm going to attempt to wake up Valerie, because I have to go get my brother and get some stuff at the store for tonight.  Its my first home and garden party.  I had to quit walmart because it was getting too difficult to  bend over and lift things, and by the time morning came, I was so sore I could barely walk.  I tried to get switched, I even talked to the damn store manager about it, but it didn't work and my mom just told me to quit because it wasn't worth mine or my baby's health.  so I did.  

Signing out for now.

Man...I can't wait till I can eat anything I want again.  This is one of the few things I don't like about pregnancy.  I'll be hungry and fix something to eat, but as soon as I start eating it I can just tell that its not going to settle right and I'm going to pay for eating it later.  >.<  Picky child.  So far, I can eat bread, some kinds of soup, fruit, and precious few other things.  Luckily its enough of a variety for me to still be able to eat healthy, but its just barely that.

I've been sleeping all day and I'm still tired.  Amazing how that works out, eh?

Not really.  I may be off work but that doesn't mean anything.  It only means something when I have money and I'm off of work.  Then it is freedom.  Then I can go have fun with my freedom.  But you see, being poor and waiting for my next paycheck, I am not free.  Instead, I am at home online...debating on what to eat...whenther or not I should write more in my live journal...and I've been staring at a dead fly for about 10 seconds now as I type this...anyway!

A few friends are coming to pick my up in the morning to go to Cyber Punk, which is a group of roleplaying nerds such as myself getting together.  most of them work at walmart with me.  Most of them are on the maintanence crew. Der fooonnny!!!

Its been a long time, and for that I apologize.  I've been working nights, so I sleep until about 7:00 or so at night and then I spend the rest of the time before work trying to wake up, eat, and get ready.  When I go online, its on my days off and even then sometimes I don't have the brain to write.  

I beleive that I am perminantly stuck in softlines (clothing and apparel,) which isn't too bad, but some of the boxes are quite heavy and a couple of the girls I work with leave everything to the last minute.  Becky is really good and so is Melissa.  Both are hard workers and are interesting to talk too.  But when Norma and Martha work, I seem to get into trouble in the mornings.  I don't when the other two work.  Norma and Martha are the ones who seem to leave everything to the last minute.  They are bound and determined to get EVERYthing onto the floor, even though it is quite impossible unless you stash them places.  We always manage to get the pallets to the back room far to late when they work and being the one who my manager Lori seems to magnitize too in situations like this, I get chewed out because we weren't off the floor on time.  -hits head-  There really is no use in trying to convince them anything.  However, I have a great respect for those two.  They are very hard workers and Norma always has a smile on her face.  However, I feel like Val sometimes when she looks at my eyes and notices the brown dot.  I just want to rip it out.

Anyhow, work isn't too bad.  It has it's ups and downs, good people, and its bad people.  But for the most part, I think the only thing keeping me from liking this job as much as it deserves is the fact that its over night and by lunch, my legs feel like they are about to fall off under my butt.

I got a nose bleed last night.  The second one I've ever had in my life and both have happened during this pregnancy.  A couple people suggested I talk to my doc about it.  Maybe I will.  Its probebly not too important.  

lol -shakes head-  Jack, one thing.  I love you!  You are my comic releif now.  Every time I feel down I picture what you tell me to picture and I laugh all night.  ^.^ It really is a beautiful image, what you have created in my head.  Oh god, sometimes I'll be stocking a rack and it will be so silent, then there it pops up out of the blue.  

Its so weird.  I'm like...half a month away from my third trimester.  Everything is going by so fast!

She is also a wiggleworm, she likes her hands, and we got to see her yawn!  She's so beautiful!  Well, what I could see of her. By 10 to 30, I mean its ten minutes to 3:30 a.m. at the moment.  To answer the question of why I'm up at 3:30 in the morning is simple.  I'm used to staying up all night and can't sleep whether I want to or not.  So, I'm staying up and wreaking havoc on the cyberworld.  In a while, after I'm updating this journal of course, I'm going to go inside, drink from the milk carton and debate on whether or not I want to kick back in a recliner and watch a movie, or go downstairs and attempt to sleep.  

I ate a cheeseburger earlier.  It tasted like shit.  I haven't eaten fast food in a long time, so thats probebly why it tasted like shit.  ^.^ but oh well.  I went and saw Charlie and the chocolate Factory earlier.  That is such an awsome movie.  ^.^ I liked it just because it was so weird.  Tim Burton is a Genius.  I can't wait to see The Corpse Bride.  

I can't find any good roleplays.  Oh well.  I go in for my ultrasound in...two days.  I'm so excited.  I hope we find out what it is.  I mean, I'm far enough along to be able to tell, but if the baby isn't exactly forthcomming...yeah.  you know what I mean.  I was thinking about going up to Jump Creek for a few hours, but I slept too late into the day.  I used to go there alot.  I haven't been there for a while.  I miss the waterfall so much and how it feels so cool when your next to it despite how hot it is.  I want to sit on my big rock and just stare at the water. 

I'm also sorely tempted to visit the old Pen again, but I doubt I'll go right now.  At some point I just want to go up there so I can see the cork tree and stuff.  Maybe get a piece of it.  -shrug-  dunno.  

Anyway, just wanted to update and make sure everyone knew I was alive.  On another note, This child will be either a great soccer player, or a helluva good boxer.  maybe Karate or something...but either way, this child doesn't sit still very oftan and man does it like to kick!!!

I am updating!  I've been sick for the past few days. :P  It sucks.  Either I ate something that was bad, or I'm catching that stupid stomach virus thats been going around.  Its been three days and I'm still not 100%.  Anyhow, a few days ago, as I was working on restocking the pharmacy (I hate, HATE mind you, the pharmacy...-grumbles-), I heard a song that I've heard a few times before, but only in the company of Brandon.  I stopped my work and listened to it, and just had to smile.  I think I heard that song every time at least once when I was in his car.  It brought back alot of memories and made me think about how much I miss him, but the old times are gone now and we've gone our seperate ways.  I hope he is okay.

I go in for my first Ultrasound in a week from tomorrow.  I'm really excited, as are alot of people.  I am starting to feel the baby really kick.  You can't feel it on the outside yet, but with the strength of the kick already, it shouldn't be much longer. 

I have decided to tell you all what boy's name I have chosen, overlooking my original qualms in NOT saying anything before.

If the child is indeed a boy, his name will be Lewis Oliver.  I have liked both names for a while, and recently came to find out that I loved them both together.  

Now, the girls name is one I'm keeping to myself -evil grin-  just because I can, and because Em keeps pestering me about it.  :P so there.

Lets see here, Oh yeah!  my friend heather from work has been trying to set me up with guys there >.<  I don't want to go out with anyone there!  I proves to be a distraction and neither of us would be able to perform well enough.  On top of that, its just...I don't want to date right now.  Its not a good time.  So I told her that.  -withering look- She's still doing it.  But I can't escape her, she's my partner in most of the area's I work.

Anyhow, I'm going to go and get some shtuff done.

I would have loved to walk down that aisle with my peers and accept that scrap of paper that I had been working for for twelve years (you know what they say:  Twelve years of hell for a peice of paper and a handshake). It would have been worth it to hear "Schools out forever" over the intercom one last time when the aides took over the office and the intercom.  It would have been worth all the time I had spent actually attempting to study just to see the proud looks on the faces of my teachers and family.  To say that I finally made it.  I had finally reached my goal.  It would have been so worth it.

But I don't have that.  Sure I have a graduation ceremony at TVCC, but its just not the same.  I'll be graduating with people I haven't known but for a month tops.  For some reason, even though I'm glad I got my G.E.D., I feel this sense of disapointment in myself.  This self loathing that I couldn't even stick it out for a whole four years, even if it was just to say that I actually did it.  I get to walk with strangers.  I was so excited when I got it, but now, its seems so distant and I'm all but lost and without a sense of security.  I've lost a part of myself that I can never get back.  I've lost alot that I can never get back.  I can honestly say, that if I could change one thing, it would be that could have paid more attention and actually stayed in school.  I would have done my Sophomore year over again.  I would have been careful not to get caught up in all the shit that I had done.  I would have saved myself alot of greif, guilt, and shame.  I never thought I would say that I miss the stuff I got from highschool.  But I do, and it saddens me.  You can never go back, they say.  And you can't.  I wish I could, but I can't.  I'm caught in the descisions I made, and that that I thought would never catch up to me, finally has.  I'm paying for my mistakes in full now.  Every last one of them.
